meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>dry</kanji>. This verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to get dry</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to become dry</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to be dried</vocabulary>. You're not doing the drying, it's just happening. That's <reading>coo</reading>', you say, things can get dry all by themselves.
readingMnemonic: The <reading>川</reading> (かわ) has started <vocabulary>to get dry</vocabulary>. Need to use less water around here otherwise it'll become completely dry.
